alt: A BBC map of eastern Ukraine showing the territories held by Russia and Ukraine. Poltava is highlighted on the map
article_heading: Ukraine says soldiers among 51 killed in Poltava missile attack
description: The image is a map that provides a geographical and political overview of a region. The map is color-coded to represent different entities and their military control status. The colors used are red, purple, and blue, each representing a different level of military control.  The map shows several countries and regions, including Ukraine, Moldova, Crimea, and Russia. The country of Ukraine is highlighted in red, indicating that it is under Russian military control. Crimea, a region of Ukraine, is shown in purple, suggesting that it is annexed by Russia. The rest of Ukraine is depicted in blue, indicating that it is held or regained by Ukraine.  The map also includes a legend in the bottom left corner, which explains the color coding. The legend states that red represents Russian military control, purple represents annexed Crimea, and blue represents held or regained Ukraine.  The map is sourced from the BBC, as indicated in the bottom right corner. The date of the map is September 21, 2021, as noted in the bottom left corner. The map provides a visual representation of the political and military situation in the region, specifically the annexation of Crimea by Russia.

description: The image depicts a group of five individuals, presumably a family, standing outdoors in a grassy area. The central figure is a man wearing a blue shirt, standing between two women and two children. The man appears to be middle-aged, with short hair and a beard. He is smiling and looking directly at the camera.  To the man's left is a woman with blonde hair, wearing a colorful, patterned top and a necklace. She is also smiling and looking at the camera. To the man's right is another woman with blonde hair, wearing a blue top and a necklace. She is also smiling and looking at the camera.  In front of the man, there is a young girl with blonde hair, wearing a blue and white striped top and overalls. She is holding a small medal around her neck and is looking at the camera with a neutral expression.  To the right of the man, there is another young girl with blonde hair, wearing a blue top and jeans. She is holding a bouquet of sunflowers and is looking at the camera with a smile.  The background shows a building with large windows, suggesting that the photo may have been taken in a park or a similar public space. The sky is clear, indicating fair weather. The overall atmosphere of the image is cheerful and familial.

article_heading: Inside Pokrovsk - the vital Ukrainian town in Russia's sights
description: The image depicts an elderly woman sitting on a public transit vehicle, possibly a bus or a train. She is wearing a patterned blouse with a mix of green, white, and black colors. The woman is holding a black bag with a red handle and a red pet carrier with a black base and a red top. The pet carrier has a mesh front, allowing visibility of the pet inside. The woman appears to be in a seated position, facing slightly to her right, and her expression is neutral. The background is blurred, but it seems to be an urban environment with a sign that reads "BEE" in large red letters, suggesting the name of a station or a route. The lighting in the image is bright, indicating it might be daytime.

alt: Map showing Pokrovsk
article_heading: Inside Pokrovsk - the vital Ukrainian town in Russia's sights
description: The image is a map that illustrates the territorial control in a region that includes parts of Russia, Ukraine, and other neighboring countries. The map is color-coded to represent different entities or regions of control.   The map shows a large area in red, which is labeled as "Donetsk," indicating that this region is under the control of the Donetsk People's Republic, a self-proclaimed state in eastern Ukraine. Adjacent to it, there is a smaller area in orange, labeled as "Chasiv Yar," suggesting that this is under the control of the Ukrainian government.  In the north, there is a large area in blue, labeled as "Kramatorsk," which is under the control of the Ukrainian government. To the west, there is a smaller area in purple, labeled as "Pokrovsk," also under Ukrainian control.  The map also includes a legend in the bottom left corner, which provides a key to the color coding. The legend indicates that red represents the Donetsk People's Republic, blue represents the Ukrainian government, and purple represents the Ukrainian military control.  The map is overlaid with a grid that provides a scale, indicating distances in kilometers. The source of the map is cited as the International Security and Arms Control Association (ISW) for the period from 21 October to 5 September.  The map is a visual representation of the complex territorial dynamics in the region, showing the shifting boundaries and control between different entities.

description: The image depicts a lively scene of a group of people riding motorcycles on a dirt road. The road is surrounded by a natural landscape with trees and bushes, suggesting a rural or semi-rural setting.  In the foreground, a person is riding a black motorcycle with a red and blue flag attached to the back. The rider is wearing a yellow shirt with a green logo on the front, black pants, and pink shoes. The rider appears to be in motion, as indicated by the blurred background.  Behind the rider, there are several other motorcycles and riders, all moving in the same direction. The riders are wearing a variety of clothing, including helmets, and some are carrying flags or banners. The motorcycles vary in color and design, adding to the diversity of the scene.  The image captures a moment of motion and camaraderie among the riders, possibly during a group ride or event. The focus on the rider with the flag in the foreground, along with the blurred background, gives a sense of speed and movement to the scene.
